alert.note: Alert for Arches, Grand Flat (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 11 at 3:39PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Grand County through 415 PM MDT... At 339 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles north of Canyonlands National Park, or 24 miles south of Green River, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Grand County. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 191 in Utah near mile marker 135. Utah 313 between mile markers 13 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
